website_summaries.verdict: This tool has some of the sharpest blades we tested and can withstand a heavy amount of use.
pros: Manufacturer focused on maximizing leverage when designing this tool
It can get through hardened rods
Also, the jaws of the PowerGear Bolt Cutter should last the test of time
Otherwise, the lifetime warranty ensures you can't make a bad purchase
cons: Some problems with rust if the tool isn't stored correctly

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use for a 5' tall lady
customer_reviews.text: I trap lost dogs to return them to their owners. When it is cold out, as it is today (-10) the lock on the humane dog trap gets frozen. I won't leave a dog in the trap in the cold (or heat) for more than 30 minutes and therefore have to frequently cut locks off. This does the job quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Not 30% easier for me
customer_reviews.text: I work in a business that we cut many 1/4" thick bolt seals. I could not cut them without using my chest. I was really hoping this different mechanism would have more leverage in a tighter package, but I didn't see that with this. I do suspect if the leveraging surfaces were posished and the bolts has roller bearings, an improvement could be achieved. The concept is there, but the execution where it counts is poor. I am not saying it doesn't cut what they claim it does, Im saying it didn't cut what ai needed it to with the claimed reduction in effort. You may have better results with standard grades of metal.
customer_reviews.author: iamscotticus

customer_reviews.title: Inferior Chinese Metal Do Not Buy, Junk Product
customer_reviews.text: Anything wider than a chainlink fence and the 24” version isn’t going to cut it. These certainly couldn’t cut any of the items shown in these photos. A strap hook got caught on my car’s luggage rack, it couldn’t cut that. In fact, it dented the edge of the cutters. See pics, more damage to cutters than the hook. Testing on progressively smaller items we haven’t found anything it can cut yet.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: They brag about having more power than standard 14 inch ones but honestly i don't really find that to be true. Takes just as much effort to cut through small screws and all-thread. Unless you absolutely cant use a larger bolt cutter. Don't get these. Definately don't expect them to do anything, any other 14inch cutters will do.
customer_reviews.author: David Stuart

customer_reviews.title: but its fine it still got the job done for what I ...
customer_reviews.text: Product came used, you could see that its bitten through a few things, but its fine it still got the job done for what I needed it for.
customer_reviews.author: John Perez

customer_reviews.title: Reviews say the 14 does not cut lock bolts. So I bought the 24 and return the 14
customer_reviews.text: I bought 14 inch never used it return it for the 24 in I rather reviews on the 14 doesn't cut locks bolts. I purchased because Fisker is a good company and their axes are awesome
customer_reviews.author: Char

customer_reviews.title: These work good, but the teeth/cutting part is a bit short
customer_reviews.text: These work good, but the teeth/cutting part is a bit short. We use it mainly for cutting bolts off of our truck loads. Sturdy construction. It takes a lot of force to cut the bolts (for a girl).
customer_reviews.author: Miseys

customer_reviews.title: There are far better for the money
customer_reviews.text: Rusted almost immediately. Blade bent cutting a very cheap small lock. Never thought I’d say this about a Fiskars product but don’t buy these cutters. They’re junk.
customer_reviews.author: Luke D. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: A great cutter!
customer_reviews.text: A high quality bolt cutter the handles are long enough and stong enough to slice easily thrus Compact but powerfu; highest quality at a reasonable price and the padded handles make a pleasure to use.
customer_reviews.author: Rob E.

customer_reviews.title: These Suck
customer_reviews.text: Had to really struggle with these. That extra power bit is pure nonsense. I used a different pair, the same size, that cut like butter. These are pure garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Broliath

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected. Cut a lot of barbed wire into short length with this - plus a few nails. No marks on jaws at all. Good value and should last a long time. Lifetime warranty too.
customer_reviews.author: Buckeye

customer_reviews.title: He mostly uses it for nails rhubarb and fencing great item good quality great name
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this item I bought it for him for his birthday and he loves it, great quality great value easy to grip non-slip and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: DebraJ Anania

customer_reviews.title: Did what I bought them for.  Cut like butter...
customer_reviews.text: Needed to cut a lock on something my son forgot the combination to and these made little work of the job...
customer_reviews.author: The Brady Report

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have been replacing a deck and many of the nails are not coming up so I have had to cut them close to the support beams and bang them the rest of the way in. The bolt cutters are not sharp enough to cut through the nails.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Get

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: not as strong as i was expecting good for thick wire but not much above that.
customer_reviews.author: A. from Beaverton, OR

customer_reviews.title: Amazng bolt cutters just
customer_reviews.text: These bolt cutters work great so far I have not cut a lock with them yet but used them to cut a bed spring. My real gripe with them is the blades started rusting already but so far does not affect how it cuts for the price it's a buy you will not find better for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Anghellic

customer_reviews.title: Great bolt cutters quality
customer_reviews.text: Very nice cutter made with quality in mind and have the proper leverage needed for the size
customer_reviews.author: Dean C.

customer_reviews.title: Fiskars bolt cutter works much better than a standard bolt cutter
customer_reviews.text: Fiskars bolt cutter works much better than a standard bolt cutter. It does not require as much force as a standard bolt cutter to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: James Oswalt

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty!
customer_reviews.text: I use these for cutting variations types of floral wire, they have worked well for what I purchased them for.
customer_reviews.author: lori hill

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Crap. Get a bolt cutter that actually cuts bolts. This might be okay for wire fencing.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Bay Person

customer_reviews.title: Fiskers puts out great quality products.
customer_reviews.text: I have not used this yet; however I am a loyal Fiskars brand customer. They have not let me down yet.
customer_reviews.author: james mattingly

customer_reviews.title: but so far these have been extremely useful and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I don't have any other bolt cutters to compare these to, but so far these have been extremely useful and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Cal

customer_reviews.title: Well-priced cutter
customer_reviews.text: Nice, well-priced small utility cutter. Great seller and transaction A+
customer_reviews.author: John Helm

customer_reviews.title: USED?
customer_reviews.text: I received the bolt cutter. I thought I was buying new and received one that was worn at the blade and significant wear on the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product, good design.
customer_reviews.text: Works good, but if you're working in a dusty jobsite gonna need lubricate it often.
customer_reviews.author: amendez

customer_reviews.title: very good, not cheap...
customer_reviews.text: mine came used. yeah, someone cut a bolt and sent it back?? - so I got it as my new one ;-( but, I could not wait and had to use it so kept it. it is very good. Fiskars stuff has been good for us. price a little high.
customer_reviews.author: diydiy

customer_reviews.title: Fiskars have always had quality tools
customer_reviews.text: they weren't for me but they worked great when I tried them out
customer_reviews.author: christian friedrich

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Cutter for IRON & STEEL
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product .We where looking for a cutter to open a seal on a container.it is so easy to use and very strong. Thank you for a wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Canavati

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Another excellent product from Fiskars. I own several of their garden tools and have always been impressed with their quality. These 24" bolt cutters work great, not only for objects like padlocks and bolts, but things like barbed wire and chain link as well. For thick materials, they seem to be very powerful and get the job done. There are comfortable to use - the handles are padded for extra comfort and they fit nicely in your hand. There are a bit on the heavy size (about 5 lbs) but sill easily manageable. I also like the orange color on the handles. I am all the time losing tools and the bright color helps me spot them faster.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip O.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, well made
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to use Requires strength, but not as much as you'd think Cons: None Summary: Use this to cut abandoned lockboxes and old padlocks off of properties. Works great. Fiskars claims this bolt cutter's gearing system takes 30% less power or strength (30% easier!), etc. No way for me to measure that, but they are pretty easy to use, as long as you have some muscles to begin with. I also have a Fiskars branch trimmer, which has worked well for years. I expect this bolt cutter will last for a while as well.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Do you need to cut through metal rods?
customer_reviews.text: If you want good bolt cutters, then you want Fiskars. They have been around for a long time and have been known for quality products. This is a great pair of bolt cutters and has a full life time warranty. The power gear technology is great. It requires less effort on your part and gets the job done easily. These are heavy duty and worth every penny - especially if you live in one of the hurricane destroyed states and have to cut through some metal (like some thieves did for people coming to help get electric back up for others). You can cut through locks, chain, fencing, any metal rod that fits in the jaws. Good times.
customer_reviews.author: CoCo's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband. Here is his review: WOW! I've owned bolt cutters in the past and also used them in the military, but this set is remarkable. With half of the force it takes to squeeze all others I've used, these broke through a lock like butter There wasn't even and hard vibration through the handles. No sharp sting against your hands when the item your cutting sheers through. Highly recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Darcia Helle

customer_reviews.title: Powerful - Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This Fiskars PowerGear Bolt Cutter is a very powerful cutting tool! I have quite a few bolt cutters that we have accumulated over the years (really not sure how) and these rate among the best of the lot. The cutters are very high quality and should last for many years. The long handles give plenty of leverage and the cutting blades are quite powerful. I tested these on a length of drive chain and it made very short work of cutting through the links. Highly Recommended! CFH
customer_reviews.author: C. Hill

customer_reviews.title: The 14" will not cut a 1/4" nail.
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered the 24" and will let it try to cut the nail. I may or may not keep the 14" model. One one hand it does cut 1/8" screws easily and it's somewhat easy to handle. I will update this review once the 24" arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Loboacan

customer_reviews.title: Cuts your nuts.
customer_reviews.text: These do a great job at cutting steel bolts and nuts. The enhanced leverage gearing is certainly an improvement but if I had my druthers I would prefer the similar 24" model by H. K. Porter, which also provides enhanced leverage for cutting, via PowerLink gearing, but has a little more heft to it and in a pinch will cut slightly thicker and harder materials than this Fiskars model. Still, overall this Fiskars model is a well-made tool.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Truthteller

customer_reviews.title: Easy action
customer_reviews.text: While I don't use these a ton, each time I snip something with them I'm pretty amazed at how easily they cut through metal. This is a pretty burley set of bolt cutters but in this case I think you'll really appreciate the quality and clever design. I'm going to have to hide these from my father in law. That's for sure!
customer_reviews.author: DDC

customer_reviews.title: Strong bolt cutters
customer_reviews.text: Great bolt cutters. I haven't had to use them much, but for the little that I have used them they work well. I had to cut a lock off of my fence and it did it with ease. Also use them to cut chain links and they do it with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ridgid302

customer_reviews.title: Sharp
customer_reviews.text: Great quality sharp blades and very sturdy. Cuts through bolts like butter and saves a lot of work. Recently cut some bolts to the floor after building a second doorway in my garage and this work wonders! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Fighting Sioux

customer_reviews.title: A great set of bolt cutters
customer_reviews.text: Works great - cuts smoothly through fencing and the smaller lock bolts I've used it on. Very nice handles which don't bit into your hand, even when you're squeezing down hard.
customer_reviews.author: Storm the Penguin

customer_reviews.title: Fiskars' quality for applications that take a bit more elbow grease
customer_reviews.text: sturdy and well constructed handles make it easy to keep a firm grim Length is long enough to give extra torch however not so heavy it becomes hard to wield.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Super solid construction
customer_reviews.text: Super solid construction. Was able to easy cut through a Master lock that was rusted shut on my back fence. Will keep this handy for future projects!
customer_reviews.author: Jish M.

product_meta.title: Fiskars PowerGear Bolt Cutter (14 Inch)
product_meta.description: Size:14 InchExperience advanced mechanics and ergonomics with a new generation of bolt cutters that deliver more strength, comfort and control. PowerGear technology gives you over 30 percent more power, especially during the toughest part of the cut. An eccentric bolt can be adjusted for optimal jaw alignment, while forged, heat-treated blades stay sharp through heavy use. Ergonomic handles with Softgrip help to improve comfort and control, while rugged steel construction guarantees long-lasting performance. This design can cut soft materials up to 3/8 inch (<19 HRC) and hard materials up to 1/4 inch (<40 HRC).
feature_bullets: PowerGear patented technology boasts leverage-enhancing gears that give you over 30 percent more power when cutting hardened rod
Adjustable eccentric bolts allow you to optimize jaw to maintain cut performance over time
Forged, heat-treated blades stay sharp, even through heavy use
Ergonomic handles with Softgrip help to improve comfort and control

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars75 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
